title: Quotient rule
summary: In calculus, the quotient rule is a method of finding the derivative of a function that is the ratio of two differentiable functions.[1][2][3] Let f ( x ) = g ( x ) / h ( x ) , {\displaystyle f(x)=g(x)/h(x),} where both g and h are differentiable and h ( x ) â‰  0. {\displaystyle h(x)\neq 0.} The quotient rule states that the derivative of f(x) is
